It is becoming increasingly clear that the reasons that lead to the impeachment process are unfounded.
The expert council of the Senate itself stated that there was no participation of me in the Safra Plan, this issue so widespread of the final pedals.
The political conditions in Brazil are in an accelerated process of deterioration, mainly at the federal level.
The interim president can not govern without talking to the suspended president of the C. of the Deputies, who has already been denounced by the STF 2x
A deep political reform is needed and the mandate of the PR is not at issue. of the Republic, but of the entire Legislative.
We are in a special moment. It is necessary to recompose achievements and open the way for the creation of a true democracy.
I have followed initiatives from @jaqueswagner, who sought to establish relations with Cunha to approve essential projects for the country to emerge from the crisis.
@ jaqueswagner has never negotiated anything concerning impeachment w / Wedge. So much so that we did not give him the votes in the Ethics Committee.
The most obvious error I made was the alliance I made for re-election, with the political group of those who had an attitude of usurpation and betrayal.
The DEM in Education is significant. The party filed a lawsuit against #Prouni, which guaranteed an increase of 1.5 million university students.
They put in the Ministry of Education who is against quotas and #Prouni.
#More Physician attributes to the claims of the 2013 manifestations for + access to basic health. Hj 63 million Brazilians are benefited
We could have been + conclusive to denounce coup articulated by the media, disgruntled q "ñ wanted to pay the duck," opposition and coup.
It is important for Brazil to fight corruption. All the institutional measures we have taken in recent years are also very important.
My government has been a strong anti-corruption initiative.
I will fight against this impeachment. In the future, I want to fight against the consequences, even if I come back, they will stay in the institutions.
